title: Drill: Feminine & Neuter (H -> Tin, To -> To)
reading_greek:
FEMININE (Article Changes Only)
- Η Μαρία -> Την Μαρία
- Η Ελλάδα -> Την Ελλάδα
- Η Τιμή -> Την Τιμή
(Noun ending usually stays the same!)

NEUTER (No Change)
- Το Βιβλίο -> Το Βιβλίο
- Το Παιδί -> Το Παιδί
- Το Νερό -> Το Νερό

MIXED DRILL
- Βλέπω τον Κώστα. (M)
- Βλέπω την Μαρία. (F)
- Βλέπω το παιδί. (N)
reading_english:
GRAMMAR: FEM/NEUT ACCUSATIVE

1. FEMININE:
   - Article: H -> Tin.
   - Noun: Usually unchanged (exceptions exist but for -a/-i nouns like Poli/Maria, it's just the article).

2. NEUTER:
   - The easiest case.
   - Subject = Object.
   - 'To vivlio einai edo'. 'Thelo to vivlio'. Identical.
audio_script:
Feminine and Neuter are easier.

For Feminine, focus on the article 'Tin'. The noun usually doesn't change.
'H ora' -> 'Tin ora'.
'H agapi' -> 'Tin agapi'.

For Neuter, relax. Nothing changes.
'To nero'. Subject or Object, it is 'To nero'.

So only Masculine nouns require you to 'Drop the S'.
